 Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Account Executive, Large Enterprise
description:
**About this role:**
 The Account Executive is a field sales role responsible for client retention and growth. Account Executives build trust-based relationships with C-Level Executives and their teams. They understand the mission-critical priorities of their clients and ensure clients receive the value from the Gartner relationship that they expect, while also identifying opportunities for stronger value delivery with alternative product offerings.
   

  

 Account Executives will be given a territory of Large Enterprise clients.
   

  

 In our Large Enterprise segment, Account Executives work with clients who have ~+$1bil in annual revenue.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Drive value delivery with current Gartner clients, ensuring clients maximize the value they receive from their Gartner services
* Identify, cultivate, qualify, and close client growth opportunities through cross-sell and upsell
* Continually build a pipeline of high-quality opportunities to deliver against your sales metrics, ensuring KPI’s are met
* Quota responsibility for your assigned territory.
* Manage complex high-revenue sales across matrix and diverse business environments.
* Own forecasting and account planning on a monthly/quarterly/annual basis.


**What you will need:**
* 5-8+ years’ B2B sales experience, preferably within complex, intangible sales environments
* Experience selling to and/or influencing C-Level Executives
* Proven track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets.
* Proven ability to own, manage, and forecast a complex sales process.
* Willingness to conduct travel as needed.
* Bachelor's degree preferred


**What you will get:**
* Competitive salary, generous paid time off policy, charity match program, and more!
* Uncapped commission structure
* World-class sales training programs and skill development programs
* Annual "Winners Circle" event attendance at exclusive destinations for top performers
* Collaborative, team-oriented culture that embraces inclusion
* Professional development and career growth opportunities


**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective business and technology insights, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our vast, virtually untapped market potential offers limitless opportunities – opportunities that may not even exist right now – for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
   

  

 Job Requisition ID:105636
   

  

 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
   

  

 Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy
   

  

**For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.**

title: Growth Minds - Community and Communications Director
description:
**About Growth minds** 





 Growth minds is a fellowship of startup and scale-up founders and executives in Stockholm. Members pay an annual contribution to participate in a curated community of leaders who meet consistently to sharpen their thinking, grow their companies, and support one another while building a better Europe.
 




  





**We bring members together through:** 




**• Tables** 

 — groups of ~10 leaders who meet monthly for structured, confidential discussions centered on business, family, and self.
 





 •
 
**Afterworks** 

 — monthly social gatherings for the full community.
 





 •
 
**Education sessions** 

 — private sessions where founders share practical, experience-based insights.
 





 •
 
**International trips** 

 — e.g. Silicon Valley, Marbella, Berlin.
 




  






 We are expanding quickly, including new branches in Copenhagen and additional countries coming next year. As the network grows past 100 members, we are strengthening the team to continue delivering an exceptional member experience.
 




  






 Members of Growth minds lead some of the fastest-growing companies in the region. Recent collaborators come from Lovable, Tandem Health, Revolut, Spotify, and many others. This role places you in a position to support and accelerate the impact of people in this high-performing community.
 




  





**Role overview** 





 You ensure that every member has an excellent experience throughout their year in Growth minds. The role combines community operations, member care, communication, and event planning. You run all afterworks, education sessions, and international trips. You build ongoing relationships with members, gather feedback, act on it, and improve the experience so they feel excited to continue their membership each year.
 




  






 You work closely with an event-operations staff member who supports logistics and on-site execution, while you remain responsible for planning, quality, and consistency across all touchpoints.
 




  





**Community responsibilities** 





 • Lead operational delivery of the Growth minds experience across afterworks, education sessions, and international trips.
 





 • Plan, organize, and manage events from concept to execution.
 





 • Run structured member-satisfaction workflows including onboarding, quarterly check-ins, and ongoing support.
 





 • Build feedback loops and turn insights into improvements across programming, communication, and event quality.
 





 • Ensure members feel supported and have their achievements celebrated within the broader Stockholm startup ecosystem.
 





 • Launch new initiatives such as
 
**Fika Forum** 

 , the monthly one-on-one matching program.
 





 • Support the launch of new Growth minds locations by helping set up first events and core member-experience infrastructure.
 




  





**Communications responsibilities** 





 • Manage public channels including LinkedIn, Instagram, YouTube, email, and the website.
 





 • Create written content, social posts, visual assets, testimonials, and short videos.
 





 • Publish a monthly member email.
 





 • Produce and edit Growth minds podcast episodes and prepare short social clips.
 





 • Maintain a consistent publishing cadence and keep all digital profiles polished.
 





 • Track engagement and refine tone, style, and frequency based on performance.
 




  





**Requirements (must-haves)** 





 • Strong organizational ability.
 





 • Comfortable in a fast-moving environment with high autonomy.
 





 • Strong writing and editing skills.
 





 • Proven event-planning experience.
 





 • Experience running multiple communication channels.
 





 • Comfortable with basic video editing (CapCut or similar).
 





 • Strong interpersonal skills with founders and executives.
 




  





**Additional strengths (nice to have)** 





 • Experience with membership communities, fellowships, or associations.
 





 • Experience with Notion, Squarespace, Mailchimp, Figma, etc.
 





 • Background in communications, content, community management, or marketing.
 




  





**Performance mandate** 





 • Increase member retention by 10 percent in year one.
 





 • Deliver consistently high-quality events across all formats.
 





 • Build reliable feedback loops and turn insights into improvements.
 





 • Establish organized, repeatable systems across member care and communication.
 





 • Support successful launches in new locations.
 




  





**Details** 





 Location: Huvudsta, Stockholm In-Office
 





 Reports to: COO (Graham Richardson)

title: Operations Engineer Citrix
description:
Vi på Vattenfall IT söker nu en Operations Engineer inom Virtual client & system software solutions (Citrix) som vill arbeta med utveckling och leverans av våra IT-tjänster, där säker och stabil drift är högsta prioritet. Vi erbjuder en spännande teknikroll och för dig som kandidat är det här en chans att ta plats i en organisation som genomgår en spännande förvandling med nya tekniska lösningar och utökade samarbetsytor.
   

  

 Som Operations Engineer kommer du att vara en del av ett team men vi ser även att du har förmågan att arbeta självständigt mot externa leverantörer såväl som kollegor runt om i Sverige och Europa. För dig som individ finns det stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling och påverkan i den dagliga leveransen.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga ansvarsområden**
* Drift och övervakning av centralt managerade kundmiljöer
* Säkerställa att befintliga miljöer utvecklas och ansvara för design och implementation av lösningar
* Delta i transformations- och förändringsprojekt
* Effektivisera och automatisera arbetssätt och system
* Patchhantering och uppgradering
* Felsökning i varierad storlek och komplexitet


 Kvalifikationer
   

  

* Arbetat i stora miljöer både med drift och utveckling av IT-infrastruktur
* Har 2-3 års erfarenhet av Citrix CVAD, Windows server, Windows 11
* Har kunskap om VDI, AD, GPO, Nätverk
* Behärskar svenska och engelska obehindrat i både tal och skrift
* Förstår och anammar högt IT säkerhetstänk
* Innehar körkort B


**Det Är Meriterande Om Du Har**
* Kunskaper om IT-relaterade processer och ramverk såsom ITIL
* Erfarenhet inom Ivanti Suite, FSLogix, Powershell, VMWare, vSAN, Endpoint management
* Kunskap om Netscaler, Applayering, provisioning, WEM, 2FA
* Linux erfarenhet
* Jobbat med Ansible
* Jobbat med Gitlab


 Vi söker dig som är driven, tar egna initiativ och är självgående. Du har ett genuint intresse av att lära dig och förstå ny teknik, samt visar god förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya tekniska område genom att vara framåtriktad och lösningsorienterad. Vi ser gärna också att du är förtroendeskapande, både inom den egna gruppen och mot övrig verksamhet. Du trivs i förändring och har en naturlig strävan mot ständiga förbättringar. Du har god samarbetsförmåga, och ödmjukt förhållningssätt till människor omkring dig. Du trivs att samarbeta med andra och har även god struktur i ditt egna arbete.
   

  

 Ytterligare information
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Förutom att du får vara med och forma framtidens smarta energisamhälle erbjuder vi dig ett utvecklande och omväxlande arbete med många kontaktytor. För oss på Vattenfall är det viktigt att arbete och privatliv har en god balans, därför erbjuder vi flexibilitet i arbetet samt möjlighet till att arbeta hemifrån vid behov. Vi har även en hel del andra personalförmåner som exempelvis arbetstidsförkortning, förmånliga tjänstepensionsavtal, föräldraledighetstillägg med mera. Läs mer om våra förmåner här.
   

  

 Vi är övertygade om att mångfald bidrar till att bygga ett mer lönsamt och tilltalande företag och strävar efter att vara goda förebilder när det gäller mångfald. Vattenfall arbetar aktivt för att alla medarbetare ska ha samma möjligheter och rättigheter oavsett ålder, etnisk eller kulturell bakgrund, könstillhörighet, religion/tro, sexuell läggning eller funktionsvariation. Läs mer om hur vi arbetar med mångfald och inkludering här.
   

  

**Placeringsort**
 Ringhals, Forsmark, Solna
   

  

**Kontakt**
 För mer information om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Anna-Karin Johansson, anna-karin1.johansson@vattenfall.com För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta rekryterare Catalina Roa Rodriguez, 070 00 26 802.
   

  

**Fackliga representanter**
 Akademikerna – Sofi Wadström, Ledarna – Christer Gustafsson, SEKO – Juha Siipilehto, Unionen –Patricia Ek. Du når dem via 08-739 50 00.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan senast 30 november 2025.** 
 Urval och intervjuer sker efter sista ansökningsdatum. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via vår webbplats. Vi tar inte emot personligt brev i ansökan. Du söker snabbt och enkelt genom att svara på urvalsfrågor och bifoga ditt CV.
   

  

*Att arbeta inom Vattenfall innebär att arbeta med samhällsviktig infrastruktur. Därmed är många av våra tjänster säkerhetsklassade och du kan komma att bli krigsplacerad.*
*Är denna tjänst säkerhetsklassad kommer säkerhetsprövning genomföras innan anställning, i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen. En eventuell krigsplacering sker med stöd i anställningsavtalet och lagen om totalförsvarsplikt.*
**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**
 Företagsbeskrivning
   

  

 Vattenfall är en av Europas största producenter och återförsäljare av el och värme. Våra huvudmarknader är Sverige, Tyskland, Nederländerna, Danmark och Storbritannien. Inom Vattenfallkoncernen finns cirka 21 000 anställda. Vi har elektrifierat industrier, levererat energi till bostäder och förvandlat tillvaron genom innovation i över hundra års tid. Vi vill nu göra det möjligt att leva fossilfritt och vi driver på övergången till ett hållbart energisystem.

title: Money Laundering Reporting Officer - Sweden
description:
***This job is with Wise, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
 Wise is a global technology company, building the best way to move and manage the world’s money.
   

  

**Min fees. Max ease. Full speed.**
 Whether people and businesses are sending money to another country, spending abroad, or making and receiving international payments, Wise is on a mission to make their lives easier and save them money.
   

  

 As part of our team, you will be helping us create an entirely new network for the world's money.
   

  

**For everyone, everywhere.**
**More About Our Mission And What We Offer.**
 We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Money Laundering Reporting Officer (MLRO) to join our team in Sweden. The MLRO will be responsible for overseeing and managing the institution's compliance with AML (Anti-Money Laundering) and CTF (Counter-Terrorist Financing) regulations. This role requires a deep understanding of Compliance regulatory requirements, risk management, and effective communication with regulatory authorities. The MLRO will play a crucial role in safeguarding the institution against financial crime and countering terrorism financing
   

  

**Your Mission**
**Regulatory Compliance:**
* Ensure the institution's operations comply with Swedish, relevant EEA, and International AML/CTF laws and regulations
* Serve as the main point of contact with regulatory bodies in Sweden and law enforcement agencies concerning AML/CTF issues, including the submission of suspicious activity reports (SARs) and other related reports


**Risk Assessment And Management**
* Implement, and maintain a comprehensive AML/CTF risk management framework to identify, monitor, and mitigate potential risks
* Conduct regular risk assessments and audits to ensure the effectiveness of the AML/CTF controls in place


**Policy Development And Implementation**
* Develop, maintain and implement AML/CTF policies and procedures to ensure compliance with legal and regulatory changes
* Collaborate with senior management to integrate AML/CTF considerations into the strategic development of new products and services


**Reporting And Analysis**
* Prepare and submit detailed AML/CTF reports to senior management and relevant authorities, summarising key findings, trends, and compliance metrics


**Training And Awareness**
* Design and deliver regular training programs for employees, fostering a culture of compliance and raising awareness about AML/CTF obligations
* Ensure all staff understand their responsibilities under the AML/CTF framework and know how to report suspicious activities


**Collaboration And Communication**
* Collaborate with internal teams, such as compliance, legal, and operations, to ensure a coordinated approach to AML/CTF compliance
* Maintain open lines of communication with European and global MLROs to share best practices and stay informed of industry developments


**A Bit About You**
* Minimum of 7 years of experience in AML/CTF compliance, preferably within the financial services or payments industry
* Proven track record of successfully managing regulatory relationships and compliance programs
* In-depth knowledge of Swedish and EEA AML/CTF regulations, and an understanding of the latest trends and challenges in the field
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail in reviewing complex transactions and identifying red flags
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively interact with regulatory authorities, internal teams, and external stakeholders
* Proficiency in data analysis tools
* Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and manage multiple projects simultaneously
* Fluent in Swedish and English; additional language skills are advantageous
* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Law, Business Administration, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications in compliance, such as CAMS or ICA, are highly desirable


**QualificationsAdditional Information**
 For everyone, everywhere. We're people building money without borders — without judgement or prejudice, too. We believe teams are strongest when they are diverse, equitable and inclusive.
   

  

 We're proud to have a truly international team, and we celebrate our differences.
   

  

 Inclusive teams help us live our values and make sure every Wiser feels respected, empowered to contribute towards our mission and able to progress in their careers.
   

  

 If you want to find out more about what it's like to work at Wise visitWise.Jobs.
   

  

 Keep up to date with life at Wise by following us onLinkedInandInstagram.

title: Systemutvecklare till Riksgälden
description:
**Senior Systemutvecklare C#/.NET – vill du lösa unika matematiska och finansiella utmaningar?**
 Vill du använda din tekniska spetskompetens för att göra samhällsnytta i finansmarknadens centrum? Riksgälden står i centrum för statens ekonomi, och vi söker nu en senior systemutvecklare till vår enhet för System- och analysutveckling. Du kan vara den vi söker. Välkommen med din ansökan.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
 Det här är en roll för dig som har en bred teknisk erfarenhet och som trivs med att analysera komplexa finansiella och matematiska frågeställningar – problem som du inte hittar någon annanstans. Vår IT-verksamhet är en integrerad del av kärnuppdraget, och på grund av extremt höga säkerhetskrav finns all vår drift och utveckling inom våra egna väggar. Här blir du en del av ett agilt team där du arbetar nära lösningsarkitekter, kravanalytiker och testare för att bygga system där arbetet präglas av öppenhet, hög intern effektivitet och kvalitet.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som senior systemutvecklare hos oss får du ta ett brett ansvar över hela utvecklingskedjan. Du kommer att arbeta med allt från databasnära implementationer till frontend och säker integration. Du har en mycket god förståelse för mjukvaruarkitektur och databasmodellering och är van vid att arbeta proaktivt för att säkerställa en god förvaltningsbarhet.
   

  

**Dina Huvudsakliga Arbetsuppgifter**
* Utveckla, testa och felsöka system, integrationer och API:er.
* Arbeta brett över hela stacken, från att processa SQL-data till implementation i frontend (t.ex. Razor, telerik).
* Aktivt identifiera och lyfta teknisk skuld för prioritering hos förvaltningsledaren.
* Bidra med din erfarenhet av mjukvaruarkitektur och systemdesign för att säkerställa långsiktiga lösningar.
* Etablera och underhålla bygg- och deployhantering i Azure DevOps.


**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som är professionell, öppen och trygg i din yrkesroll. Du är en självgående utvecklare som tar ansvar för din uppgift från start till mål. Du är kvalitetsmedveten och har en stark problemlösande analytisk förmåga som du gärna delar med dig av för att hjälpa teamet att nå sina mål. Med din helhetssyn förstår du hur dina tekniska val påverkar verksamhetens viktiga uppdrag.
   

  

**Skallkrav**
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom System-eller webbutveckling.
* Djup kunskap och väletablerad erfarenhet av C#/.NET och kan tryggt och självständigt hantera hela utvecklingslivscykeln i våra affärskritiska system.
* Mycket god kunskap och erfarenheter av SQL Server och databasmodellering.
* Erfarenhet av enhetstester.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska språket och obehindrat kunna uttrycka dig väl, i tal och skrift.
* Svenskt medborgarskap


**Meriterande krav**
* Examen från högskola/universitet inom systemvetenskap, datateknik eller motsvarande.
* Erfarenhet från bank- och finanssektorn.


 Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid pålitlighet och lämplighet för tjänsten, liksom dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Välkommen med din ansökan som innehåller CV, personligt brev, examensbevis och relevanta betyg. För att du ska få en så rättvis och korrekt bedömning som möjligt är det av stor vikt att du uppger år och månad för varje anställning samt en kort beskrivning av arbetsuppgifterna i ditt CV.
   

  

 Skicka ansökan senast
 **den 5 december 2025.** 
 Ange referens 2025/552 om du skickar in ansökan på annat sätt än digitalt via Riksgäldens hemsida. Vi erbjuder en tillsvidaretjänst och tillämpar inledande sex månaders provanställning.
   

  

 För information om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta enhetschef Markus Svart, 08-613 46 01 och kring rekryteringsprocessen senior konsult Erik Perborn, erik.perborn@randstad.se eller 076-855 76 12. Fackliga representanter är: Linn Hedman Saco-S och Lena Niklasson, ST-Riksgälden som nås via växeln: 08-613 45 00.
   

  

 Riksgälden erbjuder generösa semestervillkor, löneväxling till pension, friskvårdsbidrag, friskvårdstimmar och tillgång till gym. Alla medarbetare har tillgång till en egen plats på kontoret och vi erbjuder möjlighet att arbeta på distans 2,5 dagar i veckan om arbetet tillåter.
   

  

**Om Riksgälden**
 Riksgälden spelar en viktig roll i samhällsekonomin och på den svenska finansmarknaden. Vi bidrar till att statens pengar och finansiering hanteras effektivt och att det finansiella systemet är stabilt. Vårt kontor finns i centrala Stockholm och vi är drygt 240 anställda. Vår vision är att tillsammans göra Riksgälden till en förebild både i Sverige och internationellt. Våra värderingar präglas av öppenhet, trygghet och professionalitet i utförande av vårt arbete. Riksgälden strävar efter att vara en hållbar och attraktiv arbetsgivare, där mångfald, olika erfarenheter, kompetens och bakgrunder tas tillvara. För mer information se riksgalden.se

title: Data Platform Architect
description:
**Title:** 
 Data Platform Architect
   

  

**Reports to:** 
 Head of Architecture
   

  

**Group:** 
 Digital and Synthetic
 **Capability:** 
 Architecture
   

  

**Level:** 
 S5
   

  

**Work Arrangement:** 
 Hybrid
   

  

**Company Overview**
 Metrea is a defense company dedicated to translating commercial innovation into solutions for the hardest problems in national security. With deep mission expertise, Metrea focuses on delivering effects-as-a-service across Aerospace, Electromagnetic & Cyber, Digital & Synthetic domains via its capability groups. Metrea also consists of six support groups (Operations, People, Finance, Legal, Strategy and Solutions) that guide the development of specific capabilities that Metrea's files (product, projects, programs etc) leverage to achieve their targets.
   

  

**Group Overview**
 The
 **Digital and Synthetic Capability Unit (D&S)** 
 is committed to providing mission-driven information solutions that seamlessly bridge the digital and physical realms. Leveraging cutting-edge technologies and advanced platforms, we empower operational readiness and elevate situational awareness across diverse domains—including air, maritime, and space.
   

  

**Position Summary**
 We are seeking an experienced Data Platform Architect to lead a cross-functional data & cloud engineering team in the design and implementation of our next-generation cloud-native data platform.
   

  

 This role will be responsible for architecting a comprehensive data ecosystem that supports diverse data ingestion and consumption patterns, advanced data structures, and appropriate storage solutions while owning and adhering to our data ontology.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
**Architecture & Design**
* Design and architect scalable, cloud-native data platform solutions supporting both real-time and batch processing workloads
* Define data architecture patterns, data models, and integration strategies across heterogeneous data sources
* Establish API-first design principles and create comprehensive API specifications for data services
* Design data governance frameworks, security models, and compliance strategies
* Create technical roadmaps and guide technology stack decisions


**Technical Leadership**
* Lead a cross-functional team including data engineers, cloud engineers, and software engineers
* Collaborate with data scientists and analytics teams to understand platform requirements for advanced use cases
* Drive architectural reviews and technical decision-making processes
* Mentor engineering teams on best practices for data platform development
* Establish coding standards, design patterns, and operational procedures


**Platform Strategy**
* Evaluate and recommend technologies for data ingestion, processing, storage, and serving layers
* Design multi-tenant, self-service data platform capabilities
* Architect solutions for data lineage, quality monitoring, and observability
* Plan for platform scalability, performance optimization, and cost management
* Ensure platform supports diverse data types (structured, semi-structured, streaming)


**Stakeholder Collaboration**
* Work closely with product managers to translate business requirements into technical solutions
* Partner with security and compliance teams to ensure data protection and regulatory adherence
* Collaborate with infrastructure teams on cloud resource planning and optimization
* Present architectural decisions and trade-offs to leadership and technical teams


**Skills And Experience**
* 8+ years of experience in data engineering, platform architecture, or related fields
* Technologist with proven experience in building innovative and ground-breaking data solutions.
* Proven experience architecting large-scale data platforms in cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP) and leading technical teams
* Deep understanding of data processing frameworks (Spark, Kafka, Flink, Airflow)
* Strong knowledge of data storage technologies (data lakes, data warehouses, NoSQL, streaming)
* Experience with containerization, orchestration (Kubernetes, Docker), and microservices and event-driven architectures
* Proficiency in API design and development (REST, GraphQL, gRPC, JSON, Kafka)
* Understanding of data governance, security, and compliance frameworks
* Excellent communication skills with ability to present complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
* Solid programming fundamentals with ability to review code and guide technical decisions across multiple languages
* Experience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, CloudFormation)
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices
* Knowledge of monitoring and observability tools (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack)
* Experience with data catalog and metadata management tools


**Additional Eligibility Qualifications**
* Advanced degree in Computer Science or Engineering
* Understanding of analytics and data science workflows
* Certification in major cloud platforms
* Experience with data mesh or federated data architecture patterns


**Our Culture**
 Metrea’s single core value, “rooted in humility,” is supported by four key attributes: entrepreneurial, systematic, discerning, and over-deliver. These attributes, combined, form our Teammate Firmware, our culture. We explore these attributes during the hiring process when we grow our teams and continually support the growth of our culture. We are a hyper-collaborative, dynamically hierarchical organization united by a passion for what we do, how we do it, who we do it with, and who we do it for.
   

  

**Benefits**
 D&S UK
   

  

 Private Medical Insurance
   

  

 Subsided gym membership / plans through Wellhub
   

  

 Electric Car scheme
   

  

 Cycle to work scheme
   

  

 £1500 Training Allowance
   

  

 30 days annual PTO plus b/h
   

  

 Eye Tests
   

  

 D&S Sweden
   

  

 Friskvård of 5K annually
   

  

 Personal development budget (2K for books, courses, subscriptions etc)
   

  

 Parental leave
   

  

 5% occupational pension (swe. tjänstepension),
   

  

 30 days of leave
   

  

 Discretionary Bonus
   

  

**Right to Work**
 The employee will have the legal right to work in the United Kingdom and will be able to produce right to work documentation.
   

  

**Work Authorization / Security Clearance**
 Ability to achieve and maintain a Security Clearance.
   

  

**Equal Opportunities Statement**
 Metrea Management is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or other characteristics protected by law.
   

  

**Position Type and Expected Hours of Work**
 This is a full-time non-exempt position with typical working hours of Monday through Friday, 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Hours and work shifts may change in accordance with department and business needs. Exempt Employees must have the ability to be on-call and available, as business needs require. Non-Exempt employees may be required to work over 40 hours per week with approval from the department manager.
   

  

**Work Location**
 UK / Sweden
   

  

**Work Environment**
 This job operates in an office setting

title: Systemutvecklare - Tech lead till Riksgälden
description:
**Systemutvecklare - Tech lead C#/.NET till Riksgälden**
 Är du redo att ta ett tekniskt ledaransvar i finansmarknadens centrum? Riksgäldens IT-avdelning söker nu en Tech lead till vår enhet för Systemutveckling. Ditt uppdrag är att säkerställa att vår teknik och arkitektur håller högsta kvalitet för att förvalta statsskulden och säkra det finansiella systemet. Är du den vi söker? Välkommen med din ansökan.
   

  

****Vi erbjuder dig****
 Vår IT-verksamhet är en integrerad del av vårt kärnuppdrag. Som Tech lead är du den tekniska bryggan mellan utvecklarna och verksamhetens intressenter. Du får ett tydligt mandat att forma den tekniska färdplanen, agera mentor och förankra mjukvaruarkitektur för system som verkligen är viktiga för Sverige.
   

  

 Riksgäldens IT-avdelning omfattar fyra enheter: IT Infrastruktur, IT Service, IT System- och analysutveckling, IT Systemutveckling och består av totalt drygt 50 medarbetare. Tjänsten är placerad på enheten Systemutveckling. På Riksgälden är vi ca 240 medarbetare som sitter i centrala Stockholm.
   

  

 Som vår Tech lead balanserar du djupt tekniskt arbete med tekniskt ledarskap. Du är fortfarande en senior utvecklare i grunden och deltar i utveckling, test och felsökning, men ditt primära fokus är att leda och kvalitetssäkra teamets tekniska arbete.
   

  

 I din vardag kommer du arbeta med, och sätta ramarna för vår stack, som huvudsakligen består av C#/.NET, SQL Server och Entity Framework . Vi använder Blazor och Telerik för frontend, N-Unit och N-Crunch för enhetstester. Allt vårt arbete hanteras i Azure DevOps med GIT.
   

  

**Dina Huvudsakliga Ansvarsområden**
* Leda det dagliga tekniska arbetet och agera teknisk mentor för teamets utvecklare.
* Ansvara för att ta fram och förankra mjukvaruarkitektur och systemdesign i Riksgäldens arkitekturforum.
* Säkerställa att systemleveranser sker enligt plan och uppsatta kvalitetsmål.
* Agera teknisk "bro" och förmedla komplexa tekniska koncept till icke-tekniska intressenter och beställare.
* Omvärldsbevaka och utvärdera nya trender och verktyg för att säkerställa en effektiv och modern utvecklingsmiljö.
* Äga och driva arbetet med teknisk skuld i dialog med förvaltningsledaren.


****Din profil****
 Som teknisk ledare hos oss är du professionell i ditt agerande, öppen för teamets idéer och trygg i dina arkitekturbeslut. Du är självgående och har en utpräglad helhetssyn. Vi tror på tillit och att beslut fattas så nära arbetsgruppen som möjligt. Du har ett naturligt ledarskap och trivs med att leda genom god samarbetsförmåga gentemot din omgivning. Du har en stark problemlösande analysförmåga och är kvalitetsmedveten uti fingerspetsarna.
   

  

**Krav**
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom System- eller webbutveckling.
* Djup och omfattande erfarenhet av C#/.NET.
* Van att ta fram och äga mjukvaruarkitekturen för storskaliga eller affärskritiska system.
* Erfarenhet av att diskutera och förankra tekniska lösningar med beställare och icke-tekniska parter.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska språket och obehindrat kunna uttrycka dig väl, i tal och skrift.
* Svenskt medborgarskap


**Meriterande**
* Examen från högskola/universitet inom systemvetenskap, datateknik eller motsvarande.
* Certifieringar inom Microsoft och/eller mjukvaruarkitektur och systemdesign.
* Kunskap om certifieringshantering.
* Erfarenhet från bank- och finanssektorn.


 Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid pålitlighet och lämplighet till tjänsten samt dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Välkommen med din ansökan som innehåller CV, personligt brev, examensbevis och relevanta betyg. För att du ska få en så rättvis och korrekt bedömning som möjligt är det av stor vikt att du uppger år och månad för varje anställning samt en kort beskrivning av arbetsuppgifterna i ditt CV.
   

  

 Skicka ansökan
 **senast den 5 december 2025.** 
 Ange referens 2025/730 om du skickar in ansökan på annat sätt än digitalt via Riksgäldens hemsida.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en tillsvidaretjänst och tillämpar sex månaders provanställning.
   

  

 För information om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta enhetschef Markus Svart, 08 613 46 01 och kring rekryteringsprocessen Senior konsult Erik Perborn, erik.perborn@randstad. se, eller 076-855 76 12.
   

  

 Fackliga representanter är: Linn Hedman Saco-S och Lena Niklasson ST-Riksgälden som nås via växeln: 08-613 45 00.
   

  

 Riksgälden erbjuder generösa semestervillkor, möjlighet att löneväxla till pensionssparande, friskvårdsbidrag, friskvårdstimmar och tillgång till gym på arbetsplatsen. Alla medarbetare har tillgång till en egen plats på kontoret och vi erbjuder möjlighet att arbeta på distans 2,5 dagar i veckan om arbetet tillåter.
   

  

**Finansiellt innehav**
 Som anställd på Riksgälden har du en skyldighet att anmäla ditt innehav av finansiella instrument. För att som anställd på Riksgälden få inneha aktier i bank krävs särskilt tillstånd.
   

  

**Säkerhetsklassad tjänst**
 Som anställd vid Riksgälden kan du komma att bli krigsplacerad, utifrån totalförsvarets behov. Vissa roller är placerade i säkerhetsklass och svenskt medborgarskap kan därför vara ett krav . En säkerhetsprövning kommer att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas. Om tjänsten är inplacerad i säkerhetsklass kommer även en registerkontroll att ske.
   

  

**Om Riksgälden**
 Riksgälden spelar en viktig roll i samhällsekonomin och på den svenska finansmarknaden. Vi bidrar till att statens pengar och finansiering hanteras effektivt och att det finansiella systemet är stabilt. Vårt kontor finns i centrala Stockholm och vi är drygt 240 anställda. Vår vision är att tillsammans göra Riksgälden till en förebild både i Sverige och internationellt. Våra värderingar präglas av öppenhet, trygghet och professionalitet i utförande av vårt arbete. Riksgälden strävar efter att vara en hållbar och attraktiv arbetsgivare, där mångfald, olika erfarenheter, kompetens och bakgrunder tas tillvara. För mer information se riksgalden.se

title: Application Specialist Finance
description:
Join Dustin as an Application Specialist Finance and drive the future of our financial systems, combining your finance expertise with IT skills to make a real impact.
   

  

**This is what makes the position as Application Specialist Finance unique**
* Ownership of FP&A and consolidation applications: Take full responsibility for developing, optimizing, and governing financial software to ensure it supports business objectives effectively
* Integration and efficiency: Ensure seamless integration of finance applications within the IT landscape while streamlining processes for accurate and timely reporting
* Planning, consolidation & reporting excellence: Drive the design and maintenance of systems for financial planning, analysis, consolidation, and reporting to enable informed decision-making


 My name is Joakim Påhlman. I am the Manager of Integrations and Support Applications. As a leader, I am curious, empowering, and open to exploring alternative ways to improve processes, encouraging my team to innovate and grow.
   

  

**Your role & influence as Application Specialist Finance**
*Responsibility* 
 : You will be given responsibility for developing and executing a long-term roadmap for financial systems, enhancing functionality, supporting users, and collaborating with Finance and IT to ensure efficient, accurate, and future-ready processes.
   

  

*Collaboration* 
 : Together with your team, you take care of enabling and optimizing financial systems, collaborating closely not only with your immediate team members but also with the Business Control and Group Financial Control.
   

  

**Core Activities**
* Strategic roadmap: Develop and execute a long-term plan for the finance application portfolio, aligning it with business objectives and technology advancements
* Cross-functional bridge: Act as the link between Finance and IT, ensuring systems meet business needs while following technical best practices
* User support & enablement: Provide guidance and support to finance teams, helping them fully leverage system capabilities


**Benefits Of Joining Dustin**
 We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us. Curious? Our Life at Dustin - Dustin Sweden page has you covered.
   

  

**For This Role Specific You Can Expect**
**You can find more of our benefits below in the vacancy.**
****This is what we imagine you bring****
 We envision you as a curious and driven individual who thrives at the intersection of finance and technology, using your technical skills to optimize planning, budgeting, forecasting, and analysis.
   

  

**Additionally, It's Important That**
* You have a bachelor’s degree in Finance, IT, or a related field
* Technical finance background with IT skills, including Anaplan and SQL
* Experience with ERP, Financial Planning & Analysis, Consolidation tools, and strong analytical skills
* Ability to prioritize, make strategic decisions, and build collaborative relationships


****What can you expect next?****
 To Ensure a Fair Recruitment Process Free From Unconscious Bias, We Handle Your Application Anonymously And Do Not Accept Cover Letters. Please Refrain From Sending One, So That The Selection Is Based Solely On Professional Competencies. We Expect The Following Steps In The Recruitment Process
   

  

* Telephone screening with TA partner Filippa Olivecrona
* 1st interview with hiring manager Joakim Påhlman
* Assessment (Personality- and cognitive thinking test)
* 2nd interview Sara Wennerström & Bianca Weber


 For questions about the position, please contact the TA Partner Filippa Olivecrona via e-mail.

title: Key Account Manager Foodservice
description:
**Job Description**
**About this position**
 We have an exciting opportunity available for a
 **Key Account Manager** 
 to join our Nordic HQ in central
 **Stockholm** 
 and make a difference at Kraft Heinz in the
 **Nordic Away From Home market** 
 . You will be working in a high performing team, alongside peers always trying to reach the next level and will report to the Head of Away From Home. In this role you get the opportunity to play a key role in shaping the future GTM model for the Nordic priority area Away From Home.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Business Development and Managing strong customer relationships
+ Develop the business by transitioning from a distributor to a hybrid GTM model
+ Manage Away From Home direct accounts, including pricing and investments
+ Identify and acquire new customers to expand market reach
+ Maintain strong relationships with customers, ensuring retention and satisfaction
+ Strategic Planning and Execution
- Create and execute a yearly direct channel strategy, including customer investments and plans
- Contribute to a long- term channel strategy to take the Nordics business to the next level
- Sales Performance and Reporting
* Track and report sales performance, ensuring key KPIs are met
* Conduct forecasting and demand planning to ensure a smooth supply chain

**Your Qualifications*** A Bachelor’s degree holder (preferably in Sales, Business Administration or Marketing). A Master’s degree will be considered as a plus
* +5 years’ experience in a similar/relevant position in Key Account Management, experience from Grocery/ FMCG Foodservice is a plus
* Other skills MS Office
* Languages Fluent Swedish and fluent English skills

**Professional Skills*** Ability to Simplify. We like to keep it simple. And to execute fast. Your ability to simplify will be highly appreciated, when you provide simple solutions dealing with complex challenges.
* Commercial Sense and Growth Mindset. You are always seeking for opportunities to expand your business and create more savings, while over delivering your targets.
* Strong negotiation skills. Confidence and ability to handle customer negotiations
* Analytical. We are a very data driven company. You know how to translate complex data into a simple solution and business opportunities with your analytical mindset, understanding the P&L and how to evolve it.
* Result driven. You are an owner and do not only focus on your own results, but always do what’s best for the company.
* Curiosity, positivity & enthusiasm. You are curious, positive, and enthusiastic. People know you as the driver of the team. You are a team player, and relationship builder.

**What We Offer*** A collaborative and inclusive workplace culture
* Opportunity to develop skills and grow within a global organization
* A competitive salary and excellent bonus structure (above market)
* Hybrid working model 2 days from home and 3 days in the office in central Stockholm
* Wellbeing programs- like our Employee Assistance Program and Family Support Program

**Our hiring process**
 After your application has been reviewed, you will be invited to have an initial phone call with the Talent Acquisition Team. If this is positive, you will have the following interviews
   

  
* Onlinetest
* Head of Away from Home and Head of HR
* In-person case presentation to the Head of Away From Home and Cross-function colleagues
* Online test
* Everything positive? Then you are ready for Kraft Heinz!


 Location(s)
   

  

 Stockholm
   

  

**Kraft Heinz is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Underrepresented Ethnic Minority Groups/Women/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity and other protected classes** 
**.**

title: Operations Manager - Aparthotel
description:
**About Bob W**
 I’m Bob W, your friend in town. I take the guesswork out of travel, blending the best of both worlds: hotel-grade consistency, local character, and a few surprises only locals would know. Every apartment is fully carbon offset and set up in Europe’s most interesting neighbourhoods, so you feel at home—just with better coffee and smarter tech. I’m building a new kind of stay: five-star comfort, local flair, and always a step ahead on sustainability. All you have to do is show up. I’ll handle the rest.
   

  

**The Role**
 Are you an enthusiastic and visionary leader with a proven track record in driving operational excellence? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment where you can shape and grow a business from the ground up? If you are ready to make a significant impact and take on the challenge of managing our operations in Stockholm, then we have an exciting opportunity to join us at Bob W as a General Manager!
   

  

 As an Operations Manager, you will support the Area Manager in launching and managing local operations, ensuring efficient oversight of our apartments and partner network. Your role will involve initiating and implementing new processes and managing budgets and P&L in our Stockholm properties. You will lead your team to deliver exceptional guest experiences, fostering a positive and engaging culture.
   

  

**Job Level: M3**
 Learn more about our career development framework here.
   

  

**Furthermore, in this role you will:**
* Manage and launch local operations, focusing on 5-star guest experience, profitability and business growth.
* Manage and own the budgets and P&Ls for our properties in Stockholm.
* Define and scope your team goals based on company-wide OKRs and lead your team to deliver exceptional results.
* Take on the responsibility for hiring, onboarding, and offboarding team members.
* Develop cross-functional partnerships, actively solve problems, and unblock team members while positively challenging and encouraging participation.
* Be an active role model for Bob W's mission, strategy, and culture.


**Our 5-star candidate has:**
* 5+ years of experience working in operations or hospitality with P&L ownership.
* Experience in hiring, onboarding, offboarding and leading a team.
* Customer service-driven attitude and passion for delivering world-class guest experiences.
* Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to proactively anticipate and address potential issues.
* Excellent communication and time management skills.
* Fluency in Swedish and English.


**We offer:**
* The opportunity to reinvent the world’s largest industry by shaping a young and dynamic tech company with huge growth ambitions.
* Employee share option plan.
* Unlimited holidays.
* Free nights and generous discounts at Bob W locations.
* Oliva mental well-being platform access.
* Sports compensation.
* Development and growth opportunities, along with an L&D budget.
* Regular team events.
* Smart and highly motivated team with a multicultural, diverse, and rewarding work environment.


 Read more about
 **our team life and perks & benefits** 
 .
   

  

 Please note that this position will be closed as soon as a sufficient number of qualified candidates are identified. We encourage interested applicants to submit their applications promptly.
   

  

*We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*
 I’m not just running hotels; I’m changing how you travel. I’ve taken the best bits from hotels (think: reliability, service, all the essentials) and mixed them with the warmth and quirks of a real home. My spaces are designed for living, working, and unwinding—whether you’re here for a night or a few months. Every detail’s considered, every location feels like it’s yours. This is your home in the city, minus the chores. This is Bob W.

title: Senior QA Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*

 **Essential requirements:**


Senior Experience in QA & Test Automation  

* Proven track record as a QA Engineer with hands-on experience in automated testing, integration testing, and performance testing within complex IT environments.

  

Mentoring & Leadership in Testing Practices  

* Ability to mentor and guide system and acceptance testers, particularly in large-scale, multi-team programs.

  

Strong Communication & Stakeholder Management Skills  

* Comfortable working closely with roles such as Program Test Lead, Product Owners, Architects, and Tech Leads to ensure quality alignment.

  

Experience with Large, Complex Systems/Projects  

* Background in large-scale transformation initiatives, including systems with complex integrations.

  

Structured & Detail-Oriented with Problem-Solving Skills  

* Ability to define and organize testing efforts independently, even when initial requirements are vague or evolving.

  

Technical Background in QA or Development  

* Education or experience as a developer or technical tester, capable of understanding the technical landscape and test architecture.

  

**Meritorious:**  

Experience with Migration Testing  

* Background in supporting data or system migrations, particularly validating transitions between legacy and modern platforms.

  

Knowledge of Custody Domain  

* Understanding of custody services or securities is a plus

  

Mainframe/AS-400 Knowledge  

* Familiarity with mainframe systems (e.g. AS-400) adds value, especially if legacy integrations are involved in the migration.

  

**Last day to apply**: 02-12-2025 **About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Delivery Roll-Out Lead
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**

  

* Maintain and communicate overall roll-out timelines in collaboration with relevant stakeholders
* Keep task lists and risk registers updated and visible to all involved parties.
* Facilitate alignment meetings and ensure clear communication of progress, risks, and dependencies.
* Assist in defining and keeping KPIs relevant and updated
* Support teams in resolving blockers by connecting them with the right resources and stakeholders.
* Prepare and organize status updates and risk reviews for leadership and stakeholders.
* Monitor roll-out progress and escalate issues when timelines or deliverables are at risk.
* Organize and facilitate retrospectives to capture learnings and improvements for future roll-outs.
* Drive continuous improvement in roll-out practices and tools to enhance efficiency and collaboration.

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**  

* Structured and proactive with strong organizational skills.
* Ability to manage multiple stakeholders and keep everyone aligned.
* Strong understanding of operational processes and change management principles.
* Strong communication skills—able to convey complex information clearly and effectively.
* Problem-solving mindset with the ability to anticipate risks and propose mitigations.

  

**Application deadline:** 05-12-2025  

  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Test Manager
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**  

**Test Strategy & Planning**


* Define the overall test strategy, scope, objectives, and governance across ST, SIT, FAT, and UAT.
* Identify test resources, tools, environments, and data needs.
* Align testing timelines with overall project milestones and global rollout plans.

**Test Preparation & Execution**

* Lead hands-on development of test scenarios, test scripts, and test data (with Test Coordinator support).
* Execute and oversee testing across all phases, ensuring complete coverage and readiness.
* Manage end-to-end defect lifecycle: triage, prioritization, follow-up, RCA, and closure.
* Ensure proper documentation, evidence, and test compliance.

**Leadership & Stakeholder Management**

* Guide and mentor the Test Coordinator and testers across functional, integration, and business streams.
* Collaborate closely with Business, Product, Integration, Solution, and Delivery teams.
* Provide clear reporting: progress, risks, dependencies, defect trends, and quality metrics.
* Facilitate daily stand-ups, checkpoints, and triage meetings.

**Continuous Improvement**

* Improve test processes, templates, traceability, and quality standards.
* Identify opportunities for reuse, optimization, or automation.

  

**Skills & Competencies**:

  

* Strong understanding of full testing lifecycle and methodologies (Agile/Waterfall/Hybrid).
* Hands-on testing capability with ability to lead detailed execution activities.
* Excellent communication, leadership, and stakeholder engagement skills.
* Proficiency with test management tools (JIRA, Zephyr, ALM, or similar).
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.

  

  

**Most important things:**

* 8–12 years in software testing with proven experience leading multi-phase testing (ST, SIT, FAT, UAT).
* Hands-on creation of test strategies, test scripts, test data, and execution cycles.
* Experience in large enterprise or ERP environments (SAP preferred).
* Experience in high-criticality or global rollout programs is an advantage.
* Knowledge of CAFM/IWMS or Facility Management solutions is beneficial.

  

  

  

  

**Application deadline:** 05-12-2025  


  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?

Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
