title: Senior Data Engineer SAP
description:
Professional Galaxy is looking for a
 **Senior Data Engineer SAP** 
 for one of our clients, who is passionate about building scalable analytical solutions across Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and SAP Datasphere. This role combines deep expertise in SAP data with modern cloud engineering practices, enabling the company to maximize the value of its data assets for business and customer impact.
   

  

**You will:**
* Take end-to-end responsibility for building, optimizing, and supporting new and existing data products aligned with our target vision.
* Champion DevOps principles, managing CI/CD pipelines, Terraform, and cloud infrastructure primarily on GCP.
* Deploy analytical features across SAP Datasphere, while integrating with GCP-native tools such as BigQuery, Dataflow, and DBT.
* Ensure data products meet non-functional requirements for security, scalability, observability, and performance.
* Collaborate closely with Product Owners, stakeholders, and cross-domain product teams to support data mesh concepts and deliver customer-centric solutions.
* Coach and mentor other engineers, lead programming sessions, and present solutions to complex problems with a wide perspective on engineering practices.
* This dual role offers a unique opportunity to combine cloud-native engineering on GCP with SAP Datasphere expertise with, while working in a highly agile and collaborative environment.


**Responsibilities**
* Build and optimize data pipelines and products across GCP.
* Manage CI/CD pipelines, Terraform, and GCP infrastructure.
* Integrate SAP data sources (ECC, CAR, EWM, General Ledger, Billing, Inventory, POS) into cloud-native solutions.
* Model and provision data using CDS Views and Datasphere.
* Ensure compliance with standards for security, scalability, and performance.
* Collaborate on data mesh initiatives across product teams.
* Drive continuous improvement and reduce technical debt.
* Facilitate Scrum events and coach teams in Agile practices.


**Qualifications**
**Core Requirements**
* 10+ years of experience in data engineering, including full lifecycle implementations.
* Expertise in GCP tools: BigQuery, Dataflow, DBT.
* Strong knowledge of SAP Retail scenarios (ECC, CAR, EWM).
* Experience with frontend analytics: PowerBI.
* Proficiency in data formats (Avro, Parquet) and query languages (SQL).
* Programming skills in Python, Java, or Scala.
* Experience with NoSQL and RDBMS databases.
* Strong background in data volume management and large-scale data projects.
* Experience in Integrated Planning/BPC.
* Advanced knowledge of SAP data analytics and modern engineering practices.
* Excellent collaboration and communication skills; fluent in English (Swedish is a plus). Preferred
* Business understanding of the retail industry.
* Experience with Agile frameworks and supporting tools.
* Scrum Master experience.
* Strong problem-solving skills with ability to code solutions in complex situations.


**Duration** 
 : 2026-01-01– 2026-12-31
   

  

**Application Deadline** 
 : 2025-12-06
   

  

 Please apply directly through our system with:
   

  

* Your updated CV
* Availability to start the assignment


 In the motivation, describe why you are suitable for this assignment - refer to previous consulting assignments, employment, education and personal qualities.
   

  

**Please note:** 
 We do not accept any applications through mail. All applications have to be sent through the portal to be valid.
   

  

**Offer continuously:** 
 Please note that for this role we offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested, we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: SAP PM/EAM Konsult
description:
Position Description
   

  

 Känner du dig nyfiken på nya utmaningar som som SAP Plant Maintenance konsult? Vill du jobba på en flexibel arbetsplats där du får jobba med spännande uppdrag? Vi söker nu erfarna SAP PM/EAM konsulter till vårt härliga team i Stockholm!
   

  

 CGI är ett av världens största oberoende tjänsteföretag inom IT och affärsprocesser och vi har ett nära samarbete med SAP som Guldpartner. På den svenska marknaden är vi en av de största SAP-leverantörerna, med en aktiv och nationell SAP Practice där vi utbyter kunskap och erfarenhet med varandra.
   

  

 Välkommen till CGI!
   

  

 Your future duties and responsibilities
   

  

 I rollen som SAP Plant Maintenance (SAP PM/EAM) konsult hos CGI kommer du att vara en viktig kugge i leveransen gentemot våra kunder och ingå i ett team med mycket kunniga och trevliga kollegor. Du kommer även att ha möjligheten att utveckla och växa CGIs SAP team inom området Plant Manintenance, samt samarbeta med våra konsulter på Business Consulting inom detta verksamhetsområde. Främst arbetar vi i rena implementations- eller förbättringsprojekt, men vi är även stolta över de fina AM-tjänster vi levererar till flera kunder. Så har du erfarenhet av och trivs i förvaltningsleveranser finns även den möjligheten.
   

  

 Vårt övergripande SAP-erbjudande sträcker sig över områden som bland annat S/4HANA, S/4HANA Cloud, SuccessFactors, User Experience, Ariba, och Concur, men såklart också med kunder som ännu inte tagit steget till den nya SAP-plattformen. I vårt team finns det goda utvecklingsmöjligheter och det är egentligen bara du själv som sätter stopp för hur långt du kan utvecklas. Vi satsar på våra konsulter och lägger stort fokus på att våra medarbetare mår bra.
   

  

**Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role**
 Vi ser att du har minst fem års erfarenhet av SAP Plant Maintenance (SAP PM/EAM) och relaterade verksamhetsprocesser. Om du inte redan arbetat i S/4HANA ser vi att det är viktigt att du är nyfiken på området och beredd att göra en kompetensresa, inkluderat SAP nya lösningar inom området.
   

  

 För den här rollen kommer vi att lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Rollen som konsult innebär en omväxlande vardag där du behöver ha en förmåga och drivkraft att bygga och utveckla goda relationer för att skapa en stark samarbetsförmåga. För att framgångsrikt kunna lösa de utmaningar som du och ditt team ställs inför söker vi dig med ett analytiskt tänk och en kreativ problemlösningsförmåga. För att trivas hos oss bör du dessutom ha en affärsmässig inställning, ett stort eget driv och gilla utmaningar.
   

  

 För den här rollen är det ett krav att du kan tala svenska obehindrat.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en heltidstjänst, med placering i Stockholm, och normalt sker arbete ifrån vårt kontor i centrala Stockholm och ditt eget hemmakontor.
   

  

**Tycker du detta låter intressant?**
 Vad roligt! Sök till tjänsten redan nu då vi rekryterar löpande. Har du funderingar så kontakta gärna mig, Nina Broman som är rekryterande chef för denna tjänsten på: Nina.b.Broman@cgi.com.
   

  

**Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.**
 Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…
   

  

 You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.
   

  

 Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.
   

  

 You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.
   

  

 Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.
   

  

 SAP PM/EAM Konsult
   

  

**Job Description**
 Känner du dig nyfiken på nya utmaningar som som SAP Plant Maintenance konsult? Vill du jobba på en flexibel arbetsplats där du får jobba med spännande uppdrag? Vi söker nu erfarna SAP PM/EAM konsulter till vårt härliga team i Stockholm!

Du kommer även att ha möjligheten att utveckla och växa CGIs SAP team inom området Plant Manintenance, samt samarbeta med våra konsulter på Business Consulting inom detta verksamhetsområde. Så har du erfarenhet av och trivs i förvaltningsleveranser finns även den möjligheten.
   

  

 Vårt övergripande SAP-erbjudande sträcker sig över områden som bland annat S/4HANA, S/4HANA Cloud, SuccessFactors, User Experience, Ariba, och Concur, men såklart också med kunder som ännu inte tagit steget till den nya SAP-plattformen. Vi satsar på våra konsulter och lägger stort fokus på att våra medarbetare mår bra.

Rollen som konsult innebär en omväxlande vardag där du behöver ha en förmåga och drivkraft att bygga och utveckla goda relationer för att skapa en stark samarbetsförmåga. För att framgångsrikt kunna lösa de utmaningar som du och ditt team ställs inför söker vi dig med ett analytiskt tänk och en kreativ problemlösningsförmåga. För att trivas hos oss bör du dessutom ha en affärsmässig inställning, ett stort eget driv och gilla utmaningar.

 Vad roligt! Sök till tjänsten redan nu då vi rekryterar löpande. Har du funderingar så kontakta gärna mig, Nina Broman som är rekryterande chef för denna tjänsten på: Nina.b.Broman@cgi.com.
   

  

**Ensemble, en tant que propriétaires, mettons notre savoir-faire à l’œuvre.**
 La vie chez CGI est ancrée dans l’actionnariat, le travail d’équipe, le respect et un sentiment d’appartenance. Chez nous, vous pourrez exploiter votre plein potentiel parce que…
   

  

 Nous vous invitons à devenir propriétaire dès le jour 1 alors que nous travaillons ensemble à faire de notre rêve une réalité. C’est pourquoi nous nous désignons comme associés de CGI, plutôt que comme employés. Nous tirons profit des retombées de notre succès collectif et contribuons activement à l’orientation et à la stratégie de notre entreprise.
   

  

 Votre travail crée de la valeur. Vous élaborerez des solutions novatrices et développerez des relations durables avec vos collègues et clients, tout en ayant accès à des capacités mondiales pour concrétiser vos idées, saisir de nouvelles opportunités, et bénéficier d’une expertise sectorielle et technologique de pointe.
   

  

 Vous ferez évoluer votre carrière en vous joignant à une entreprise bâtie pour croître et durer. Vous serez soutenus par des leaders qui ont votre santé et bien-être à cœur et qui vous permettront de saisir des occasions afin de parfaire vos compétences et élargir les horizons.
   

  

 Joignez-vous à nous, l’une des plus importantes entreprises de conseil en technologie de l’information (TI) et en management au monde.

title: Lead Developer – Stockholm
description:
Som Lead Developer kommer du in i ett stadie då vi satsar på att skala upp vår satsning inom AI & Cloud Development. Vi söker dig som inte bara skriver kod, utan bygger lösningar som fungerar idag såväl som håller och utvecklas över tid.
   

  

 Vi vill bygga en framtid där data, AI och mjukvara jobbar tillsammans. Där systemutvecklare, data engineers, data scientists och slutanvändare arbetar nära tillsammans för att snabbt leverera värde med hjälp av den senaste tekniken.
   

  

 Här kliver du in
   

  

 Du blir del av ett växande område med runt 20 konsulter inom Cloud, AI och systemutveckling. Samtidigt får du kollegor från hela Solita med expertis i allt från data, strategi och mycket mer att dela kunskap och perspektiv med, läs mer det här. När vi växer gör dina möjligheter också det, du får vara med och påverka kulturen, affären och din roll.
   

  

 Våra kunder finns i offentlig och privat sektor, i branscher från sjukvård till e-handel, transport och energi. Vi gillar att ta oss an deras långsiktiga behov och skapa lösningar där problemet styr teknikvalen, inte tvärtom.
   

  

 En dag på Solita
   

  

 En dag på Solita kan börja med ett standup-möte med ditt team på kunduppdraget, ibland består det av fler kollegor från Solita. Är det fredag kanske du jobbar från Solita kontoret i Stockholm för att starta dagen med frukost. Andra dagar jobbar du från kundens kontor eller hemifrån.
   

  

 Sen kliver du in i ditt arbete, när du stöter på ett problem söker du upp en lång diskussionstråd i slack med insikter från kollegor som haft samma problem. Andra gånger passar du på att fråga en kollega vid kaffemaskinen om deras perspektiv för att komma vidare i ett designval du står inför. Du kan också delta i våra interna utbildningsmöten, där vi delar kunskap om allt från nya teknologier och arbetssätt till välmående. Vissa dagar avslutar du med AW, brädspelskväll eller annan aktivitet du och kollegor tycker är kul!
   

  

 Din roll som Lead Developer
   

  

 I rollen som Lead Developer utformar och leder du utvecklingen av robusta och skalbara system: lösningar som möter både affärsbehov och tekniska krav. Genom utvecklings- och designarbete, coachande av utvecklare och nära dialog med verksamheten. Samtidigt identifierar och driver du optimeringar av utvecklingsprocessen. Du kan även vara med i förundersökningar, stötta i pre-sales och rekryteringen av nya kollegor.
   

  

 Känner du igen dig i följande?
   

  

 Du Kan Kommunicera På Svenska Och Engelska i Tal Och Skrift. Det Är Ett Plus Om Du Varit Konsult Tidigare Men Det Huvudsakliga Är Din Förmåga Att Snabbt Komma In i Nya Sammanhang Och Lära Dig. Tack Vare Flera Års Erfarenhet Av Att Bygga Moderna Lösningar Genom Hela Utvecklingscykeln, Främst i C# .NET, Känner Du Dig Trygg i Rollen Då Du Fått Med Dig
   

  

* Trygghet att jobba med distribuerade system och eventdriven, skalbar arkitektur. Gärna med tekniker som Kafka, RabbitMQ eller Azure Service Bus.
* God förståelse för Dev(Sec)Ops-principer, CI/CD och orkestrering.
* Erfarenhet av molnplattformar som Azure, AWS eller GCP. Har du jobbat med containerization (Kubernetes, Docker) eller Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, Pulumi, Bicep) är det en extra tillgång.
* Nyfikenhet på AI i utvecklingsarbetet: hur verktyg som GitHub Copilot, OpenAI API:er eller ML-integrerade pipelines kan göra kodningen smartare och effektivare.


 Vi letar inte bara efter tekniska skills, vi vill jobba med dig som tar ansvar för att bygga rätt lösningar på rätt sätt genom att utmana med omtanke. Du ser kod som ett hantverk, inte bara ett medel till funktion: du bryr dig om kvalitet, läsbarhet och hållbarhet. Du kommer trivas hos oss om du tycker om att dela med dig av din kunskap lika mycket som du är nyfiken på- och lyfter andras.
   

  

 Vad vi erbjuder
   

  

 Vår företagskultur är väldigt viktig för oss. Vi värdesätter låg hierarki, självständighet och ansvar, värdeskapande arbete och trevliga kollegor. Här kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, och här kan du bläddra bland våra tech-bloggar.
   

  

* Meningsfulla projekt: Arbeta i en agil miljö där du kan påverka teknikval och arbetssätt för att skapa de bästa lösningarna
* Flexibilitet och autonomi för att utforma ditt arbete med flextider– läs mer från vår blogg.
* Ständig utveckling: Vi erbjuder kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling för att säkerställa att våra medarbetare ligger längst fram i teknikutvecklingen.
* Innovativ kultur: Arbeta tillsammans med några av de främsta experterna inom data, analys och utveckling


 Utöver detta får du även ta del av följande
 **förmåner** 
 :
   

  

 💰 Fast lön oberoende av beläggningsgrad med möjlighet till löneväxling till ditt pensionssparande
   

  

 🏖️ 30 semesterdagar
   

  

 🏥 Sjukvårdsförsäkring för både din mentala och fysiska hälsa som täcker dig även utanför tjänstetid
   

  

 🏋️‍♀️ Friskvårdsbidrag på 5000 kr via Benify.
   

  

 💻 Ett brett nätverk av erfarna specialister från olika områden inom tech att samarbeta med
   

  

 🔗 Intern coach för att stödja ditt välbefinnande
   

  

 🪩 After Work och hobbyaktiviteter
   

  

 🥐 Fredagsfrukost
   

  

 Vilka är vi?
   

  

 Solita är ett värderingsstyrt konsultbolag med över 2200 medarbetare i 9 länder, varav ca 230 i Sverige. Vår storlek gör oss tillräckligt stora för att vara en stabil och innovativ arbetsgivare, men samtidigt tillräckligt små för att värna om våra medarbetare och kunder. Med bred kompetens inom digital transformation erbjuder vi en dynamisk arbetsmiljö. Hos oss får du friheten att utvecklas, både professionellt och personligt.
   

  

 Intresserad av att höra mer?
   

  

 Låter det som en spännande utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan och bli en del av vårt team som ligger i framkant inom systemutveckling!
   

  

 Om du har några frågor, skriv gärna till Rebecca Hammel på LinkedIn eller via mail till rebecca.hammel@solita.se. Du kan också kontakta rekryteringsansvarig, Louise Doverholt på LinkedIn eller via mail till louise.doverholt@solita.se .
   

  

**Hur ser processen ut?**
 I rekryteringsprocessen tror vi på en snabb och effektiv process. Du ansöker med CV eller LinkedIn och svarar på två korta frågor. Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande. Om vi ser en potentiell matchning, bjuder vi in dig till ett första möte för att lära känna dig och berätta mer om vår kultur och våra värderingar på Solita. I andra intervjun fokuserar vi på din tekniska kompetens och din erfarenhet. Om allt går bra tar vi oss vidare till sista steget där vi presenterar ett erbjudande och välkomnar dig som ny Solitan!
   

  

 Sign up to our newsletter to hear about the latest news, upcoming events and open positions at Solita
   

  

 Subscribe

title: Exterior Designer – Spännande Uppdrag
description:
Vi söker en **Junior Exterior Designer** som stödjer teamet i utvecklingen av både koncept- och produktionsbilar. Uppdraget innebär nära samarbete med seniora designers, digitala och clay-modellerare, ingenjörer och visualiseringsspecialister.

**Ansvarsområden**
------------------

* Skapa högkvalitativa exterior designförslag och skisser som överensstämmer med designvisionen och varumärkets identitet.
* Assistera seniora designers med tema, designförfining och surfacing.
* Arbeta nära clay- och digitala modellerare för att översätta 2D-skisser till 3D-modeller.
* Förbereda presentationer, renderingar, storyboard och visuella material för interna genomgångar.
* Utforska innovativa idéer, material och formspråk som utvecklar framtida designriktning.

**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------

* Masterexamen i Transportation Design, Mobility Design eller Industrial Design.
* 0–2 års erfarenhet (inklusive praktik).
* Stark 2D-skissförmåga och visuell storytelling.
* Avancerad kunskap i Blender.
* Erfarenhet av samarbete med tvärfunktionella kreativa team.
* Flytande engelska, svenska nybörjare.

**Meriterande**
---------------

* Erfarenhet i designstudio eller konceptdesignmiljö.
* Tidigare arbete med internationella eller kinesiska bilvarumärken.
* Kunskap i Alias eller liknande 3D CAD.
* Erfarenhet av videoredigering och fotografering.

**Personliga egenskaper**
-------------------------

* Kreativ, nyfiken och passionerad för automotive design.
* Proaktiv, självdriven och detaljorienterad.
* Teamorienterad med god kommunikationsförmåga.
* Bekväm i multikulturell, snabb miljö.
* Positiv, ödmjuk och lösningsfokuserad.

**Övrig information ️**
-----------------------

* Resor: Nej
* Startdatum: 1 jan 2026
* Slutdatum: 1 apr 2026 (möjlighet till förlängning)
* CV ska vara på engelska.

### **IT/Software**

* Blender (avancerad)
* Photoshop
* Alias (eller liknande CAD)
* Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Illustrator, After Effects, Premiere)

**Faktaruta**
-------------

**Roll:** Exterior Designer  

**Senioritetsnivå:** Junior  

**Plats:** Göteborg, Sverige  

**Distansarbete:** 0%  

**Uppdragsperiod:** 1 jan 2026 – 1 apr 2026  

**Sista ansökningsdag:** 3 dec 2025 kl. 23:59  

**Antal roller:** 1  

**Timmar/vecka:** 40  

**Rate type:** Hourly


Sway Sourcing är en innovativ rekryteringspartner som specialiserar sig på att matcha rätt talang med rätt företag – snabbt och effektivt. Vårt huvudfokus ligger inom Ekonomi, Administration, HR, Marknad och IT, men vi har även den breda expertis och flexibilitet som krävs för att leverera skräddarsydda rekryteringslösningar inom alla branscher.


Trots att vi är en relativt ny aktör har vi redan byggt förtroende hos många av Sveriges största företag och arbetar både nationellt och internationellt. Med baser i Sverige och Spanien erbjuder vi en unik kombination av lokal expertis och global räckvidd. Vårt starka nätverk och djupa branschinsikter gör oss till en självklar partner för företag som vill ligga steget före i sin rekrytering.

title: Concept Engineer – Chassis & Vehicle at Engage Studios
description:
**ABOUT ENGAGE STUDIOS**


We design, innovate and build digital / physical products for the world's largest - and Sweden's smallest company. Our guiding principle is to make a difference - for the better. Ideas are good and execution is the success factor. We are people and teams who are not afraid to question, roll up our sleeves and laugh all the way to the finish line.


Since the start in 2009, we have worked with basically all manufacturing / developing companies in Sweden. The Volvo companies, IKEA, H&M, Electrolux, Lynk&Co, Zeekr, Houdini to name a few. Our customers are in the traditional Swedish industry all the way to innovative startups in Silicon Valley. They are not found in oil drilling or the military industry. We are determined to make our presence and work known with passionate and dedicated employees who love design, tech and people.

 **WE OFFER**


At Engage Studios, you will work in many different industries for different customers. You will work with incredibly smart and dedicated colleagues. Together we develop products and services that you can brag about to your friends. We at Engage Studios are always at the forefront of technology development. We develop and share knowledge with each other to get better tomorrow. With us, you get the opportunity to realize your dreams, big and small.

  

Our client is a new electric mobility technology and solutions brand that is aiming to satisfy the global demand for premium electric vehicles. Their work comes to life in products and services from world leading brands under their umbrella.

**JOB DESCRIPTION**


Support the Chassis & Vehicle Dynamics team in studying current and future platform concepts. Work closely with our clients Chassis & Vehicle Dynamics team and attribute teams to align suspension system performance. Represent the suspension and chassis systems in our clients packaging and project meetings. Create and update concept and platform parts in CAD with consideration for industrialization. Build and analyze kinematic models for package studies. Organize and maintain data in Team Center. Perform Kinematics & Compliance (K&C) analysis on suspension layouts.


 **REQUIREMENTS**


Minimum B.Sc. in Mechanical Engineering  

Minimum 3-year experience from Chassis System Development.  

A strong understanding of technical development of chassis systems and concepts.  

To be able to balance attribute requirements (mainly NVH, Vehicle Dynamics, Durability,  

Corrosion and Brakes) and experience of multiple suspension systems layouts.


Software needed: MS Office, Catia V5, Catia V5 DMU Kinematics, TcE, Adams, Matlab Simulink.

 **YOUR PROFILE**


Positive and agile attitude and interested in finding solutions together with other people / teams.  

Willing to help others and to ask for help when needed.  

Have an openness and awareness of Asian, European and other cultures.

  

 If you are passionate about development, we want to hear from you. Please apply with your resume, portfolio, and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and qualifications.

 **MERITS**

* International experience
* Visually communicative
* Tons of Passion
  
* 

  

**PLACE OF EMPLOYMENT**

Gothenburg

 **OTHER**


For questions regarding this position please contact hiring manager Susanne Lidén on susanne@engagestudios.com Applications must be submitted through the official Career site.

title: AI Experts in Applied AI & Tooling Development
description:
*A better world needs new perspectives. That requires new knowledge, new technologies, and strong forces that bring them together. RISE, Sweden’s independent research institute and innovation partner, is that gathering force. Now we are building* ***Mimer – Sweden’s national AI Factory****, a European hub for AI research* *and development, infrastructure, and adoption.*  

  

**About us**  

Within the Digital Systems division, there is the Department of Computer Science, comprising around 100 people, which provides leading expertise in the core areas of AI, Cybersecurity, 5G/Edge, IoT, advanced data analytics, as well as the development of software and data center technologies. All these areas are at the forefront of the digital transformation of industry and society and are critical for Sweden’s competitiveness.


We are now looking for **AI Experts** who will work hands-on with companies, researchers, startups, and public-sector organisations to turn advanced AI methods into practical, reliable, and scalable solutions.  

  

Mimer is one of 19 European AI Factories under the HPC framework, working to strengthen industrial competitiveness and innovation both within Sweden and across borders. The initiative comprises over 25 colleagues from RISE distributed across various units and departments, including researchers, business developers, and communicators.

**About the Position**  

This role sits at the heart of Mimer’s mission: helping organisations of all kinds apply modern AI efficiently, responsibly, and at scale. You will work directly with users and partners to solve their challenges, develop new AI tools, and make advanced infrastructure accessible.


You will operate like an AI deployment engineer:

* Working side-by-side with researchers, engineers, SMEs, and companies
* Translating needs into technical approaches - from rapid prototyping to production-ready workflows
* Developing tools, pipelines, and components that support broad adoption of AI
* Leveraging state-of-the-art methods (LLMs, agents, vision models, multimodal models, generative AI)
* Supporting users as they move from experimentation to deployment
* Helping onboard partners to Mimer’s upcoming AI/HPC infrastructure and secure platforms
* Contributing to training, workshops, knowledge transfer, and community-building activities in Sweden and Europe


You will collaborate closely with colleagues across areas such as trustworthy AI, software engineering, HPC, data management, and sector-specific teams - and contribute to Europe-wide AI Factory activities. There will also be opportunities to get involved in various RISE research projects.


We now have open positions in Stockholm and Luleå. We follow a hybrid work model that allows employees to split their working time between the office and their home workspace.

**Who You Are**  

We are looking for strong applied AI practitioners who enjoy working directly with users and solving real-world problems - people who combine technical depth with practical execution.  

  

To succeed in the roll you will need:


* Solid experience in machine learning or AI engineering
* Strong programming skills (Python, and ideally modern software engineering practices)
* Experience with building or adapting AI models, pipelines, APIs, or tools
* Understanding of data pipelines, model evaluation, and scalable deployment
* PhD/MSc degree or equivalent experience in computer science, engineering, natural sciences, mathematics
* Experience from industry, research labs, consultancy, or applied research environments
* Excellent communication skills in English


Meritorious:
 

* Experience with GPU computing, distributed training, or HPC environments is a plus
* Experience with MLOps, automation, or model lifecycle tools is a strong advantage (e.g. Kubernetes, Kubeflow, MLflow, Airflow, Argo, etc.)
* Experience with modern AI training frameworks such as DeepSpeed, Hugging Face Accelerate, or MLflow for experiment and model management
* Experience leading or coordinating technical tasks or small projects
* Swedish is a plus


We are looking for someone who is curious, pragmatic, and passionate about building solutions that deliver real value. You should feel comfortable working across different organizations and sectors, and thrive in collaborative, team-oriented environments. At the same time, you are capable of acting independently— making decisions and navigating the complexities of building something new.


Most importantly, you are driven by creating a positive impact, working for the greater good of society and ensuring the best possible outcomes for the communities we serve.


**Are we a good match?**  

At RISE, you will join a vibrant, mission-driven environment built on openness, collaboration, and innovation. At Mimer, you will be:

* Helping build Europe’s next generation of AI infrastructure
* Developing tools and methods that thousands of users will rely on
* Working hands-on with diverse AI projects across sectors
* Collaborating with leading researchers, companies, and European AI Factories
* Shaping how Sweden and Europe adopt trustworthy, efficient, and high-performing AI


If you want to be at the forefront of applied AI - where cutting-edge technology meets real societal value - we have the right position for you.  

  

**Welcome with your application!**
  

If you are interested and want to know more you are welcome to contact Thor Wikfeldt at +46 10 228 46 79. The application deadline is December 15. Apply without cover letter. Selection and interviews will take place continuously during and after the application period.  

  

Our union representatives are Ingemar Petermann, SACO, +46 10 228 41 22 and Linda Ikatti, Unionen, +46 10 516 51 61.

title: Field Service Engineer
description:
**Work Schedule**


Standard (Mon-Fri)**Environmental Conditions**


Some degree of PPE (Personal Protective Equipment) required (safety glasses, gowning, gloves, lab coat, ear plugs etc.)**Job Description**

**Job Description**


As our new Field Service Engineer, you will support customers across the Nordic region, delivering a full range of service activities — including installations, repairs, maintenance, validation, and technical support — for Unity Lab Services.  

You will primarily work with our Trace Elemental Spectrometry and Chrome product lines. (ICP-OES, ICP-MS, IC, and HPLC)


This is a field-based position, supporting customers throughout the Nordic countries. Candidates can be based anywhere within Norway or Sweden, provided you live near an international airport.


As part of the dedicated TEA Chrom Service team, you will participate in delivering market-leading on-site services that consistently exceed our customers’ expectations.

**Our Organisation**


This position sits within our Instrument and Enterprise Services (IES) organization — a single source for integrated lab services, support, and supply management. Our customized service offerings are designed with flexibility and expertise to meet each customer’s unique business needs.  

Whether providing maintenance for a single instrument or managing services across entire laboratories, we deliver tailored solutions that help our customers achieve their goals efficiently and effectively.

**What Will You Do?**

* Deliver professional fault finding, installation, preventive maintenance (PM), repair, and qualification services in a timely and customer oriented manner.
* Provide premier technical support.
* Actively promote service contracts and related products.
* Ensure customer satisfaction through clear communication, professionalism, and proactive problem-solving — bringing up critical issues swiftly when needed.
* Manage company assets effectively, including spare parts, tools, software, computer, phone, vehicle, and documentation.
* Coordinate your work schedule efficiently with internal scheduling teams for optimal service planning and dispatching.
* Submit timely and accurate reports, such as Field Service and Expense Reports.
* Collaborate with the Sales team to see opportunities, share customer insights, and support business growth.

**Who We Are Looking For**

* Educational background in Electronics, Chemistry, Engineering, or a related field.
* Hands-on experience with analytical instruments — gained as a Field Engineer, Application Specialist, Scientist, or Laboratory Technician.
* Working knowledge of ICP, ICP-MS, IC, or HPLC techniques is advantageous, but not essential.
* Proficient in English; additional Nordic languages are a plus.
* A valid driver’s license is required.
* Customer focused with excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Highly self-motivated and capable of working independently with strong organizational abilities.
* Willing and able to travel regularly across the region (typically 4–5 days per week), including some overnight stays and extended trips for training — up to 50% travel annually.

**What’s in It for You**

* Outstanding opportunities for career development within a global, industry-leading organization.
* Comprehensive training and mentoring to support your technical and professional growth.
* Competitive salary and performance bonus, along with a full benefits package.
* Company car provided.

**About Us**


At Thermo Fisher Scientific, our mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner, and safer.  

Join our global team of over 100,000 colleagues, united by a shared set of values and a passion for making a difference every day.  

Discover our colleagues explain 5 reasons to work with us — and help advance science for a better tomorrow.
company_description: At Thermo Fisher Scientific, our professionals develop critical solutions—and build rewarding careers.

title: Fullstack Engineer
description:
At Svea Solar, we have a clear vision - to fix the planet. As Sweden’s and one of Europe’s leading players in energy technology, we are driving the energy transition with solar power and smart energy solutions. ⚡
   

  

 We’re now expanding our website team with an
 **Fullstack Engineer** 
 . Are you ready to join the Power Shift?
   

  

**About The Role & The Team**
 As our
 **Fullstack Engineer (with a frontend focus)** 
 in the Website team, you’ll be part of a talented and ambitious agile team. Together you’ll design and implement technical solutions for Svea Solar’s website and related areas, ensuring a seamless experience between our site and our smart energy platform
 *Sunbeam* 
 .
   

  

 You’ll work closely with another Teach lead, a frontend engineer, an analyst, and a product manager, reporting to our Engineering Manager Anna. We follow a collaboration-first approach, working three days a week from our Stockholm office.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities:**
* Build and maintain both frontend and backend features, with a strong focus on frontend.
* Develop modern, accessible, and semantically correct websites using HTML5 and CSS3 (SASS).
* Write clean, maintainable, and well-structured code in TypeScript/JavaScript and React.js.
* Design and implement REST APIs and integrations with our CMS written in Python.
* Collaborate with designers, product managers, and fellow engineers to create functional and user-friendly solutions.
* Contribute to architectural discussions and best practices, supporting long-term scalability and event-driven design.


 Are we a match?
   

  

**We’re Looking For You Who…**
* Value team success over personal success and thrive in a collaborative dynamic environment.
* Have at least 5 years of professional experience in software development, including at least 2 years in backend.
* Have strong experience with: TypeScript, React, Node.js, Express, REST APIs, CMS, and event-driven design.
* Have solid knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, and SASS.
* Are fluent in English and Swedish.


**Bonus points if you..**
* Have experience with Next.js, i18next, Motion/React Spring, Tailwind, Styled-components.
* Are comfortable with Python, Django, Wagtail, or Deno.


 🌍 Life as a Power Shifter - What do we offer you
   

  

**The opportunity to make an impact** 
 – your work directly contributes to fixing the planet and driving the energy transition.
   

  

**About**
**A value-driven workplace** 
 – read more about our values here.
   

  

**The chance to own your results** 
 – grow, take responsibility, and power up as both we and the energy industry evolve.
   

  

**Diversity and inclusivity** 
 – different perspectives drive innovation. Here, you can be yourself and contribute with your experiences, identities, and ideas.
   

  

**Employment benefits** 
 – occupational pension, 30 days of vacation, wellness allowance, parking, and more.
   

  

**Flexibility/ hybrid work** 
 – work up to two days a week from home.
   

  

 Want to see what life at Svea Solar really looks like? Follow us on Instagram: @LifeAtSveaSolar
   

  

 ⚡Who are we
   

  

 As Sweden’s - and one of Europe’s - leading providers of energy tech and solar, we help our customers optimize their energy use with smart, connected solutions. From solar panels to heat pumps, batteries, EV chargers, and software, we’re shaping the future of energy. We call it
 **The Power Shift** 
 . And the ones driving it?
 **Power Shifters** 
 .
   

  

  

  

**About Our Recruitment Process**
* With structured interviews and assessments through Alva Labs, we make sure our recruitment process is fair, inclusive, and unbiased - because diversity is key to innovation!
* Read more about our Recruitment process here.


 👉
 **Ready to become a Power Shifter?** 
 We review applications on a rolling basis, so don’t wait to send yours in!

title: Firmware Engineer
description:
Meet
 
 Yubico
 
 : the creator of the most secure passkeys and leading provider of hardware authentication security keys. Our company’s mission is to make secure login easy and available for everyone. Yubico was founded in 2007 by Stina and Jakob Ehrensvard, and is public on Nasdaq Stockholm Main Market: YUBICO. Our customers include Fortune 500 companies, hundreds of government agencies and millions of individuals in over 160 countries that rely on Yubico technology to secure access to computers, online services and mobile apps. We  are a global company with a strong company culture and employees located in over 14 countries. Yubico’s  headquarters are based in  Stockholm, Sweden and Santa Clara, CA.  Aligned with our mission to make the internet more secure for everyone, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations helping at-risk individuals through our philanthropic initiative,
 
 Secure it Forward
 
 .
 




  





**At Yubico, we offer:**




  





**Yubico Values:
 
 We work to ensure that our employees have an open space to have their voices amplified to create a workplace where everyone feels like they belong. Aligned with this, our employees have created some pretty cool Employee Resource Groups: YubiPride, YubiBIPOC, YubiSustainability and YubiWomen. Additionally, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations in need all over the world (you can read more about our work here).
 

  





**Social Connection:**

 Relationships and connectedness matter, and we love spending time with our team! Our virtual workspace keeps us connected day-to-day whether it's through Yubico celebrating wins or our buzzing Slack communities. Check out our
 
 Life at Yubico Page
 
 on LinkedIn and our awards
 
 here
 **.**




  





 The Role:
 



  






 Yubico is seeking the next new team member for our Firmware team. We're looking for someone with a passion for security to join us in our work to develop new features for our products. Your role will be to implement established cryptographic protocols, as well as to take part in creating the protocols of tomorrow. As part of our team you'll be working on our core products and the tools and libraries which make them useful.  Use your passion, insights, and technical skills to help us create a trusted Internet.
 





  




**Tasks & Responsibilities:** 
* Develop, design and test new features for the firmware of Yubico's products, such as the YubiKey and the YubiHSM
* Write libraries and utilities to expose new features to higher level applications
* Develop integrations with existing systems to enable them to take advantage of our products



  




**Basic Qualifications:** 
* Experience with cryptography and security (such as smart cards, PKCS#11, common encryption schemes and cryptographic libraries)
* 3+ years experience with writing software for microprocessors with constrained resources
* High proficiency in C
* Familiarity with Linux, git (ideally CLI) and Python or similar high-level languages
* Experience with integrating/building open source software and the open source community
* Ability to work independently as well as in a team, capable of taking own initiatives but also listening to others






  




  


 We are an equal opportunity employer, we value diversity and uphold an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. We'd love to learn about what you can add to our diverse team.
 



  





 Yubico does not accept agency resumes or referrals so please do not send them to our careers staff or employees. Yubico is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes or referrals.
 



  





 Personal data submitted through this form is used for managing Yubico’s recruitment activities, which include facilitating any application you make, setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing results and selecting candidates, and as otherwise needed in our recruitment and onboarding processes. The use of your personal data may also be necessary prior to entering into a contract with you (that is prior to offering you a job with Yubico). Your personal data will only be used for the purposes for which it was collected and in accordance with the Yubico Privacy Notice. We only keep your personal data for as long as necessary and in compliance with Yubico’s record retention policies. If you have asked us to, we will keep you informed of other opportunities at Yubico. We do this in various ways, including email and by phone. If at any time you do not want us to contact you or use your information as described herein please contact us at jobs@yubico.com to let us know and we will delete all such information. Providing your personal data is voluntary, but necessary to join our talent community, and if you do not agree to provide your data, we will not be able to consider you as part of our talent community.
 



  





 As part of providing the requested service, we will transfer your data to be processed by Lever, Inc., a service provider contracted by Yubico AB and/or its subsidiaries that meets legally mandated privacy requirements. The Yubico Privacy Notice offers more information about Yubico privacy practices, including the lawful basis for processing of personal data, how to lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority, and how to contact Yubico to exercise your data subject rights. In this notice, when we refer to "Yubico", "us", "we" or "our", we mean the Yubico group company or companies that you apply to, or correspond with, and which are responsible for any personal data collected about you.  
 



  





  




  


 We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.**
